SUMARIO DE 'JUDAS' | CONVERSACIÓN CON XAVIER DUCH
Un CDR en prisión: "Lo que me comentó es que venía de arriba, de Presidencia, de Torra"
Ferran Jolis vincula en varios momentos al 'president' Torra con los presos ERTEl imputado dice al fiscal que se jactó de actividad terrorista en el marco de un escarceo seductor
06 Nov 2019, 19:57 by Ángeles Vázquez / Jesús G. Albalat / Íñigo Urquía
Ferran Jolis, uno de los miembros del Equipo de Respuesta Táctica (ERT) en prisión procesados por terrorismo, declaró ante el juez Manuel García-Castellón que otro de los CDR radicales imputados, Xavier Duch, le contó que los planes de asaltar el Parlament catalán venían "de arriba". "Lo que me comentó es que venía de arriba, de Presidencia, de Torra y de no sé qué movimiento, y que querían quedarse dentro del Parlament y tener las comunicaciones aseguradas", cuenta. En otro momento del interrogatorio del teniente fiscal de la Audiencia Nacional Miguel Ángel Carballo, Jolis -uno de los creadores de estos grupos- dice también que él no conocía la fecha del 'día D': "Esto es algo que era del 'president', no tenía ni idea".
El sumario detalla varios momentos en los que menciona al expresidente de la Generalitat Carles Puigdemont y a su sucesor, Quim Torra. Además de atribuirles  "una red de comunicación propia", identifica a Puigdemont como"Lisa" y a Torra como "Gandalf" y señala que el objetivo de los radicales independentistas presos contaba con el beneplácito de la Presidencia de la Generalitat.
Respecto a su papel en este intento de asalto, Jolis -que colaboró con el CDR por sus conocimientos informáticos- subrayó ante el magistrado que no quiso participar en la acción. "Me preguntaron si sería posible y yo solo lo pensé", explica.  En su declaración ante la Guardia Civil, Jolis declaró que avisó de que se necesitaban dos emisores y un receptor potentes y exigió conocer a las personas de las que procedía el encargo "para asegurarse de que sus intenciones eran reales", pero nunca volvió a tener noticias. La idea era "poder aguantar al menos una semana con el Parlament asaltado, denominando el inicio de esta toma del citado Parlamento como día D".
Jolis tampoco arroja mucha luz sobre el CNI catalán: "Algo me suena, es un poco confuso. El encargo de las antenas [en las que sí admite participar] me parece recordar que era del CNI catalán y todo el tema que se juntaba con el president Torra. (…) Lo del Parlament supongo que lo va a pagar los del CNI. Me dijeron, no se preocupe que dinero hay".



En cualquier caso, el imputado trata de poner distancia con los hechos de los que le acusan. En un momento dado, incluso, el fiscal llega a preguntarle ante su aparente intención colaboradora que si no pensó en llamar a la Policía: "La verdad lo pensé, por un momento sí, pero luego pensé que no". "Usted se presta y hace un croquis", le acusa en fiscal en otro momento, a lo que Jolis trata de escabullirse: "Pero porque iba a cobrar".
Escarceo seductor
Al acusado -que intenta justificarse señalando que a veces no sabe "decir que no"- también le inquieren sobre una conversación con Mireia Bosa, su pareja semetimental, en la que Jolis cuenta que "se está jugando el culo, porque si lo pillan le van a meter terrorismo y banda organizada". 
En este punto, Jolis pide que se le informe de cuándo fue esa conversación, a lo que Carballo le responde que el 30 de octubre de 2018. "Eran cuando empezaba la relación con mi mujer. Nos conocimos el 31 de agosto, si no me equivoco esos fueron los días en los que nos acostamos por primera vez", desliza, ante lo que el fiscal insiste y le pregunta si estaba jactándose para sacar pecho con ella. "Le dije eso a mi mujer... Pues no sé, una tontería, porque no lo pensaba", zanja.

SUMMARY OF 'JUDAS' | CONVERSATION WITH XAVIER DUCH
A CDR in prison: "What he told me is that he came from above, from the Presidency, from Torra"
Ferran Jolis repeatedly links the 'president' Torra with the ERTE prisoners. The accused tells the prosecutor that he boasted of terrorist activity in the context of a seductive dive
06 Nov 2019, 19:57 by Ángeles Vázquez / Jesús G. Albalat / Íñigo Urquía
Ferran Jolis, one of the members of the Tactical Response Team (ERT) in prison prosecuted for terrorism, declared before Judge Manuel García-Castellón that another of the accused radical CDRs, Xavier Duch, told him that the plans to assault the Catalan Parlament They came "from above." "What he told me is that he came from above, from the Presidency, from Torra and I don't know what movement, and that they wanted to stay inside the Parliament and have secured communications," he says. At another time during the interrogation of the Lieutenant Prosecutor of the National Court Miguel Ángel Carballo, Jolis - one of the creators of these groups - also says that he did not know the date of 'D-Day': "This is something that was of the 'president' , I had no idea".
The summary details several moments in which he mentions the former president of the Generalitat Carles Puigdemont and his successor, Quim Torra. In addition to attributing to them "a network of their own communication," he identifies Puigdemont as "Lisa" and Torra as "Gandalf" and points out that the objective of the imprisoned independence radicals had the approval of the Presidency of the Generalitat.
Regarding his role in this assault attempt, Jolis - who collaborated with the CoR for his computer skills - stressed before the magistrate who did not want to participate in the action. "They asked me if it would be possible and I just thought about it," he explains. In his statement to the Civil Guard, Jolis stated that he warned that two powerful emitters and a receiver were needed and demanded to know the people from whom the commission came from "to make sure his intentions were real," but he never had news. The idea was "to be able to endure at least one week with the parliament assaulted, calling the start of this takeover of the said Parliament as D-day".
Jolis also does not shed much light on the Catalan CNI: "Something sounds to me, it is a bit confusing. The assignment of the antennas [in which he does admit to participating] seems to remind me that it was of the Catalan CNI and the whole issue that came together with the President Torra. (& mldr;) The Parlament I suppose the CNI will pay for it. They told me, don't worry what money there is. "



In any case, the accused tries to distance himself from the facts of those who accuse him. At one point, even, the prosecutor comes to ask before his apparent collaborative intention that if he did not think to call the Police: "I really thought so, for a moment yes, but then I thought no." "You lend yourself and make a sketch," he accused in prosecutor at another time, to which Jolis tries to sneak out: "But because he was going to charge."
Seductive Squirrel
The defendant - who tries to justify himself by pointing out that sometimes he does not know "to say no" - is also asked about a conversation with Mireia Bosa, his semetimental partner, in which Jolis tells that "he is playing his ass, because if he gets caught they are going to put terrorism and organized gang. "
At this point, Jolis asks to be informed when that conversation was, to which Carballo replies that on October 30, 2018. "It was when the relationship with my wife began. We met on August 31, if I didn't wrong those were the days we went to bed for the first time, "he slips, at what the prosecutor insists and asks if he was boasting to breastfeed with her. "I said that to my wife ... Well, I don't know, nonsense, because I didn't think about it," ditch.
